Consideration 3: Formative assessment for goal refinement

Formative assessment can be a simple yet effective way for learners to obtain information on the learning process.

One example is to use digital tools to ask quick, pulse-type questions before and after assignments to form a longer-term picture as a knowledge base to uncover the best working habits.

Tip: Utilising this data during discussions about student progress lays a solid foundation for setting new, personalised goals informed by the learners own actions, not just on the teachers suggestions based on the memory or notes made in a busy classroom.
